alert.note: Alert for Harper (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Harper County through 9 PM CDT... At 819 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong and severe thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Fowler to 12 miles southeast of Meade State Park to 5 miles southeast of Floris. Movement was east at 40 mph. If these storms maintain intensity, a severe thunderstorm warning may be needed for northern portions of Harper county for damaging winds. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rosston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
